inn1.comm: dug in short, just outside off, good bounce, left alone
wide down the leg side from Rampaul
seams back in from short of a length and in front of off. Beats the inside edge and goes over the stumps
lovely cover-drive on the up, and a lovely stop by Pollard at short cover-point. A full-length dive to his right to save four runs
another wide down the leg side
short of a length, on off, holds its line, defended off the back foot
stays short of a length, just outside off, defended square
another defensive off the back foot as Rampaul stays short of a length
lets out a grunt as he pitches short of a length, and is defended in front of off
another grunt, another shortish ball, into the hips. Defended again
punched away nicely but can't beat Sammy at short cover-point
short of a length, wide, nicely cut away, beats short cover-point, but finds backward point
into the body, tucked away off the hip for the first runs of the bat. Samuels is slow at square leg, Rampaul slow at fine leg. South Africa take the second
third wide inside two overs. Big one down leg
fuller than the short of a length he has been bowling, but still not full enough to be playing off the front foot. At 143ks, it holds its line outside off, and beats the outside edge
short-arm pull. Ingram has got used to the monotonous shortish bowling, and sets himself up for the pull, takes it rib high, and sends it over square leg
tucked away off the pads, takes on Narine's arm at fine leg, and makes it easily. Narine not the quickest in the field
fuller, wider, Ingram throws his bat at it, but is beaten by the away movement
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
fuller, on off, seaming in, hits the inside edge on the big drive. Onto the pad. Ingram was looking to go back over the bowler's head
short of a length, on off, drops this at his toes and takes a single
short of a length, on off, angling away, left alone
full, on the pads, clipped away past midwicket for three
length ball, into the pads, asking to be punished, and Amla has timed this away beautifully through midwicket. You don;t want to be bowling there, Tino
short of a length, outside off, rising towards the chest. Fended into the ground
nicely punched away, hard into the ground, bounces over the short cover-point. Takes a single
short, wide, Ingram goes after it, but doesn't get close enough to it. Beaten
wide length ball, left alone by Amla
seaming in from length, beats the inside edge, but it is headed down leg
Ingram goes after this. Not too short, but it is wide enough for him to swing his arms, and he square-drives it over backward point
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
moves across to get inside the line of a ball outside off, works this into the leg side, takes a couple
short of a length, angling away, dabbed square on the off side for one
offbreak, the old-fashioned offbreak, spins across him, takes the edge, goes past slip
too full, and Ingram sweeps this fine
short of a length, on off, dabbed into the off side
flighted outside off, driven hard, but can't beat extra cover where Sammy makes a diving save
full, middle and leg, defended back to him
down the wicket, Narine pitches it short, and he ends up defending it back to him
good delivery. Short of a length at 149ks, rises towards the helmet from short of a length, Amla is lucky his fend doesn't fly off in the air
short of a length, pitched outside leg, 147ks, defended in front of leg
short of a length again, pulled away to fine leg
looks to punch away a shortish ball, bottom edges it into the ground. Amla takes a single because it travelling too slowly towards the cover ring
length ball, just outside off, 149ks, driven to deep cover
late on the pull, but gets a single off the glove as the ball goes towards fine leg
on a length, offbreak, driven straight of deep cover for two
short of a length, turning from outside leg, punched from in front of off, gets a single
short of a length, turning in from outside off, worked around the corner
full, just outside off, defended back to him
down the wicket to get under a length ball and smash it over long-on. When you get that close to the pitch of the ball, it doesn't matter which way the ball is turning. Out of the ground
quick offbreak, left alone outside off
short of a length, 149.4ks, dropped into the leg side for one
full, 149,9ks, pushed back to Best who threatens to throw the ball back at Ingram, who shows him the way, asking him to try hos best
short of a length, 149ks, but wide down the leg side
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point
what a ball Yorker at 149.9ks. And well done Amla too. This is in front of off, but he has got the bat down in time, and got some cue on it
short of a length, only 147ks this time, Amla plays with soft hands and takes a single into the covers. That can be frustrating when you are bowling that fast
short of a length, no room, but he arches back to run this down to third man
short of a length, wide, 125ks, cut away to deep point
short of a length, outside off, dropped wide of point, and he takes a risky single, but would have been in even if the throw had hit
length ball, on off, stops on him, he ends up chipping this drive, but there is no mid-off to accept this
short of a length, outside off, pushed to deep point
short of a length, outside off, cut away to third man
flicked away from outside off, gets a single to short fine leg
short, wide, too wide. Called too
wide length ball, he goes after it, the ball flies off the outside half of the bat, and beats point
another wide length ball, this time Amla has timed it beautifully, but can't beat cover where Gayle dives to take the sting off
half-volley outside off, driven away hard, but straight to cover
short of a length, outside off, holds its line, beats Amla who is looking to open his face

nearly run out. Amla misses out first. This is a leg-side half-volley, which he has hit straight to the little Bravo at midwicket. Amla runs with the shot, and would have been caught short had Bravo hit the only stump visible to him
played to mid-on with soft hands, and they take the single
short of a length, on the pads, defended to midwicket
Ingram is hitting them fine today. Length ball, on off, he gets under it, and smacks it back over the bowler's head
short of a length, angling across, Ingram wants to go big again, but is beaten by the angle this time
short of a length, on the stumps, runs it down to third man with an open face
pulled away, but the tennis-ball gets a bit big on him. However, the mis-hit lands short of deep backward square
too short, too slow, too wide, and Ingram has pulled it disdainfully over midwicket. What a time to bring up fifty, Colin

dropped. No, not quite. Gayle has taken the rebound. All Jamaican wicket. Samuels has lopped up a wide half-volley, Amla goes for the extra-cover drive, but doesn't get enough elevation. Gayle nearly drops it from head high, but as the ball is falling in front of him he goes down to complete the catch on the third take. Second take on the right hand, and the third on the left
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, played with soft hands, wide of point, gets a single
full, outside off, driven down the ground, but Ingram can't get out of its way
flatter, shorter, pushed wide of extra cover for one
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, turning in, defended back to him
short, AB shapes up to pull, but the turn back in cramps him up
worked into the leg side, between two men on the deep in the leg side
punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, turning away, Ingram goes for the cut, gets a thick edge wide of the slip and fine of short third man
short of a length, no room, punched to long-on for one
driven down wide of long-off, and they come back for two
poor ball. Short, wide, he rocks back, and cuts it to the right of point
full and fast, square-driven, but this time he can't beat point
short of a length, angling in, hits the inside edge onto the pad
is that dropped? No it hasn't been dropped, but the edge would have gone straight to the slip had it been there. He goes for the cut, and gets a thick one past the wicketkeeper
driven to long-on for one
full and wide, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, offbreak, whipped away off the pads
shortish offbreak, punched to deep point
tossed up outside off, driven wide of long-off, against the turn, gets a couple
carrom ball, middle and leg, pushed wide of midwicket
full, pitched outside leg, pushed into the leg side for one
bouncer, on leg stump, he ducks under it
length ball, on the pads, 147ks, pushed to mid-on for one
in-between length, 146ks, de Villiers can;t do anything with this. Defended to leg
full toss, 146ks, driven wide of deep cover for a couple
top-edged for six. That's straight from the IPL. Bouncer, no room, headed for the head, at 145ks, but the short straight boundaries means fine leg has no chance
full toss at 146ks, on off, AB needs no second invitations. Driven through cover, wide enough of deep cover, for four
short of a length, on the pads, bunted on the leg side for one
short, wide, slow, cut away to deep cover for one

slower ball does it. On a length, pitched outside leg, but Ingram is too early into the shot, and ends up skying it towards deep midwicket. Little Bravo runs to his right, a long way, and judges the catch well, and then kicks it away
short of a length, angling in towards off, runs it fine square on the off side
short of a length, on the stumps, defended back to him
short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked away for a couple
short of a length, outside off, 79mph, cut away for one
short of a length, on off, punched away for one
bouncer, outside off, gets too high for a pull for Duminy
strangled down the leg side? Or is he? This is short, down the leg side, he is trying to pull it, but ends up gloving it. Not quite a strangle
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended
wide length ball, du Plessis has driven it on the up, and between mid-off and cover. That looks so much like something de Villiers would do
short of a length, outside off, dabbed into the off side
extra bounce on this shortish delivery, beats him down the leg side, and is - I would say harshly - called a wide. That went under his armpit, man
bunted into the leg side for one
length ball, angling in, clipped away wide of deep midwicket
wide wide ball outside off
short of a length, outside off, tries to punch it, but the ball runs off the outside half of the bat for one
angling in on a length, flicked to midwicket
beauty. That's a length ball that seams it will angle in towards off, but holds its line against the angle, and beats his drive
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep point
slower ball, wide outside off, driven to long-off
driven on the up, wide of deep cover, they can come back for the third
short of a length, angling in, beats the inside edge, goes for a leg-bye
driven on the up again, but can't beat cover
through midwicket. Short of a length, pulled away powerfully, but it is only just to the right of little Bravo at midwicket. I think he doesn't even get a touch to it
starts off with an offbreak, which has been clipped into the leg side for one
short of a length, outside off, punched away
slower through the air, dipping a little, defended in front on off
carrom ball, but it is a full toss, and it has been clipped to the right of deep midwicket, and they take two even though the fielder is Pollard
another carrom ball. This one squares him up, and is defended in front of off
straighter one, tossed up outside off, du Plessis wants to drive what he thinks is an offbreak. The outside edge is beaten

Little Bravo, you beauty. What a catch. Slower short ball, de Villiers pulls it, high and to the right of midwicket. Bravo goes with it, body slanted, both feet in the air, sticks out the right hand, and holds on. And then coolly walks towards other fielders
short of a length, angling away, run down to wide of third man for two
short of a length, on off, seams away to beat his edge
driven away on the up, but Little Bravo makes a diving save at cover
bouncer, pulled down into the ground, gets a single to deep midwicket
wide length ball, runs off the outside half of the bat to third man
offbreak, beats the inside edge, hits him in front, but it is turning too much for the lbw
short of a length, pitched on off, punched to deep cover for one
sharp offbreak, beats him, and the deflection off the pad doesn't go too far
carrom ball, which he picks only off the pitch, punches this to deep cover
short of a length, offbreak, pushed to mid-on
quick offbreak, on the stumps, no turn, defended back to him
short of a length, into the pads, goes for a leg-bye
on a length, on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
driven on the up, but not timed wide, gets a single to extra cover
good bouncer, at 86mph, it kicks off late and keeps climbing as it reaches Charles. Two byes as he fails to collect it cleanly
driven on the up, to the left of deep cover where Sammy's quickness keeps them down to one
short of a length, seams away from just outside off, beats his back-foot drive
offbreak, pushed into the off side for one
driven on the up, to mid-off, Sammy wants the run-out, but fails to gather it first
poor delivery. Too short, too wide, cut away hard, in front of deep point. Gets four for it
flighted on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
Narine is being mistreated here. On a length, on off, Miller tees off, and slaps this over long-on
carrom ball, doesn't pick it, but gets an inside edge onto the pad
slightly short of a length, driven on the up. Not timed well, but he has got it over midwicket
tires the pull this time, but the mis-hit just about clears mid-on
short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked behind square on the leg side, into the gap
short of a length, on the pads, pulled straight to deep midwicket

short straight boundary. Du Plessis has targetted it. Backs away for a length ball, which turns out to be the slower ball, but he goes ahead with it and even though he has mis-hit it, it clears long-off
short of a length, down the leg side, called a wide
short of a length, angling, clipped away to deep midwicket
down the wicket, Pollard bounces him, he still goes after it, and top-edges it over the keeper's head. How IPL is enriching batsmanship
slower bouncer, du Plessis hasn't picked it, and is through the shot well before it arrives
moves across to a full ball, du Plessis gets the toe end onto it for a single
slower ball, short of a length, defended off the front foot. Had to check the shot
down the wicket, Pollard stays short of a length, slow and outside leg. No room for him. Played defensively
short of a length, pushed to cover
slower short ball, he has to wait and wait, and in the end he nearly ends up getting caught at cover. Bounces short of Rampaul
slower bouncer. Well outside leg, but that's because Miller is making room. He tries to ramp it in the end, and fails
short of a length, angling across, beats the edge as he tries to cut it. That's regulation pace
short, into the body, pulled away fine of deep square for a couple
finally one in the slot. Length ball, outside leg, 70mph, he waits for it to arrive, and sends it flying over wide long-on for six
bouncer, head high, pulled away to deep midwicket

length ball, on off, slogged wide of long-on, and what an effort from  DJG Sammy. He runs hard to his left from long-on, and then puts the full-length dive in, but only gets his hands to it. Doesn't catch it
that's in his arc, and out of the park. Short, middle and leg, 74.4mph, and he has dismissed it over midwicket for a sweetly timed six
drilled hard on the bounce to long-on for one
slower short ball, du Plessis is early into the pull and is through before the ball arrives
loopy slower ball at 60mph. It would have been a wide had du Plessis not gone on his knee and driven this wide of long-off for four
regulation place, short at 70mph, pulled away to deep midwicket

yorker outside leg, hits him on the pad, throws the stumps down as they try a leg-bye, and he has caught du Plessis short. That's a set man gone, and the new man will be on the strike too. Superb worl from Bravo in his follow-through
top edge for a six. That's a top edge, man. Short straight boundaries at it again. This is a bouncer, at regulation pace, McLaren goes for it, edges it, and it sails over fine leg
trying to bowl the slower bouncer outside leg, but McLaren is not back away to make room, and this is a wide down the leg side
tries to charge him, and is beaten by the bouncer at regulation pace
looks to pull, this is bowled at 82mph, and he is late into it, and gets a single off the mis-hit
full, on middle and leg, 85mph, so not a slower ball, but Miller is cramped on the drive, and can't beat mid-off
slower ball, outside leg, he looks to slog, but is beaten

inn2.comm: flighted outside off, driven hard, gets a single despite a hand from the diving save at short cover
big back lift first ball, the length ball doesn't turn, and beats the outside edge
lovely shot. Driven on the up, against the turn, between cover and point
short, wide, turning in, cut away, but can't beat cover-point
down the wicket, swings hard, the ball doesn't turn, goes off the thick outside edge, and over point
fat, quick, hangs up in the breeze, defended back to him. Uppishly so
wide length ball, and the extra bounce beats him
bouncer, on the stumps, he ducks under it
short of a length, outside off, left alone, collected in front of his face by AB
length ball on the pads, worked around the corner for one
tucked away off the hip to fine leg for one
length ball, angling across, Charles doesn't get close to it before driving. Beaten
we've been expecting you, Mr Steyn, says Gayle. Drives a length ball on the up, to the left of mid-off, and sends it crashing into the boards
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover, but can't find the gap
on a length, middle and leg, defended
on a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-on
short of a lenght, on the stumps, 88mph, defended from the crease
nearly taken. Driven back hard, to his left, in his follow-through Steyn gets his left hand to it, but can't hold on. Mid-on is short and wide, so they get a couple
short of a length, angling away, defended from the back foot
looks to pull, hits this to cover. Too early into the shot
length ball, doesn't quite come on, driven back towards mid-on for one
I don't know what he has done to this, but he has sent it over mid-off. Short of a length, wide, he wants to go square I am sure, but this goes off the lower half of the bat and flies over mid-off
that's a beauty. Short of a length, just outside off, he defends for the angle, but it seams away and bounces at him. Beaten
length ball, into the pads, beats his swipe, hits the pad
short of a length, just outside off, goes off the outside half of the bat for one
length ball, on the pads, worked into the leg side for a couple
backs away to a length ball, and pushes this to mid-off
short of a length, holds its line, beats him
dropped by Duminy. Leg-side half-volley, clipped away, but in the air to the right of Duminy, who goes for it, but is late and is hit on the wrist
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease

short of a length, hits the thigh pad, Gayle is slow to go, and can be run out, but Tsotsobe is not back to the stumps and the fielder has tried to lob it to the stumps and not gone for a direct hit. That was a big chance to run Gayle out
slower ball, on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
Gayle has smoked this away. If he hits like this, he might not need to run too many. Walks down the wicket, then rocks back, takes this on a length, and smashes it through midwicket
slower ball, on a length, outside off, slogged away to deep midwicket who has just gone back
short of a length, outside off, the extra tennis-ball bounce beats him
short, too short, pulled away to deep square for one
lovely delivery. Slightly short of a length, and then seams away a little. Or holds its line at best, and has beaten Charles
nice shot. This is not short, but he has rocked back to create his own length and short-armed it past mid-on for four
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
bouncer, 90mph, 145ks, that rises head high too. Charles has no clue about it
bouncer again, on the stumps, he ducks under it. Both bouncers of the over done
Charles has been unsettled and he plays the wild slog. He steps half down and slogs at this, Steyn gets the top edge from him, and AB de Villiers calls for it and runs to short third man to catch it
some swing. On off, doesn't angle in, holds its line, defended off the back foot
short ball, no stung behind it, Smith gets inside the line of it, and pulls hard into the ground and through to square leg for four
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away for one
short of a length, outside off, punched away to long-off
short of a length, outside off, left alone
slower ball, angling into off, he is early into it, is hit on the pad, but the bounce is taking it over
short of a length, angling in, punched back to him
full and flat, outside leg, called a wide
he has misjudged the length. Wants to push forward but the ball is slow, and while his feet are stuck, his body wants to go forward, and ends up playing in front of him. Edged to short third man
goes off the inside half of the bat for one
quick length ball, holds its line in front of off. Defended
full, on the pads, driven to long-on for one
full, on off, driven to long-off
short of a length, on the stumps, defended
angling across him, driven square, but du Plessis makes a brilliant save at point

length ball, driven on the up, back at him. Morris throws the ball back at him, misses the batsman and the stumps by a bit. Had it gone off the batsman - who is in the crease - he would have been in the right to go for the overthrows
short of a length, cut away to third man. Went off the edge
short of a length, on off, defended to cover for one
slower short ball, on the pads, tucked away for one
short, wide, cut away to deep cover for one
down the wicket, to the pitch of it, nonchalantly driven over the short straight boundary at long-off
quicker, into the pads, they will take the leg-bye
short of a length, angling in, he tries the back-but. The idea is right, the execution is not, but the result is. The cut takes the edge, and it goes past the diving slip
short of a length, angling in, punched into the covers for one
you don't often see Gayle sweep, but he has used the shot superbly now. Takes the length ball, and sweeps this past square leg
backs away, comes down the wicket, Morris wants to go wide, but he reaches out and drives at the length ball to send it past cover
short of a length, angling away, defended to point
short of a length, comes down hard on it, the ball bounces over point for one
murdered it. Not many other words to describe this. Chest-high bouncer, not much behind this, and he has pulled this past midwicket, all along the ground

big ball to take the big wicket. Short of a length, Gayle wants to work this to leg with the angle, but it holds its line just enough to take the leading edge to point. Boy that's some edge. It has flown to point when Gayle is looking to play with soft hands
pace like fiyah maan. Short of a length, but it climbs steeply, holds its line, beats the edge as he looks to fend. That has gone past the shoulder of the bat
full, driven to cover
driven to long-on for one
angling in, hits the inside edge onto the pad. In fact it is pad first, hits him outside the line anyway
arm ball, angling in, defended off the back foot
flighted on off, driven back to him
dead-batted off the front foot again
length ball, angling in, whipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
length ball, angling in, dropped to the leg side for one
length ball, angling in, slogged away over midwicket for four
short, into the body, pulled away between the two deep fielders on the leg side, gets a couple
dabbed away to third man for one
down the wicket to drive this to short cover
short of a length, outside off, holds its line, the extra bounce beats him
driven to long-off for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, kicked away, takes a leg-bye. I don't know how you can allow this leg-bye. He made no attempt whatsoever to play at this
drilled back at him, but straight back at him

full and fast, beats the sweep, there is an appeal for the lbw. It is not given, but South Africa have reviewed this in the rain. The ball is hitting all right, but the umpire thinks it is pitched outside leg. The replays show impact is in line, and he is gone. Big wicket. Superb review
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
dug in short, into the ribs, fended down to leg
short of a length, outside off, dropped to the left of cover for one
short of a length, he pushes at it away from the body, and edges it past the diving slip for four
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended to off
lovely flick. Length ball, on the pads, clipped away for four, to the right of long leg
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
tossed up on off, defended back to him
short of a length, outside off, pushed to the left of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, turning in, punched past cover for another single
down the wicket to push this to long-on for one
Amla has saved three runs. Samuels backs away to punch the life out of this ball. This is flying away when Amla dives to his right at cover. In this cold weather, that won't feel so good
short of a length, rising in towards the chest. He drops it to his toes and runs
Samuels opens up the front leg, and holds his stance. McLaren bowls full and straight. Driven, but straight to cover
opens up the front leg again and cuts hard, but Amla has been moved to deep cover now. This one still hits hard

full, into the pads, clipped away, and Amla has not only saved two runs, but he has also taken a wicket. Played to Amla's right at deep midwicket, he first slides and keeps the ball in. He has gone over the ropes, comes back in and throws. Meanwhile Little Bravo doesn't want the third, but Samuels does. Bravo just stands. Samuels runs hard. Seems to have crossed him so it is Bravo who is going off.I know sacrificing his wicket is the right thing for Bravo to do, but has he actually crossed? No replays showing that yet. McLaren has flicked the stumps with his legs before removing the bail, and he is not aware of it. AB de Villiers, though, has spotted it, and has asked McLaren to take the stump out too. And they don't even check if Amla has stopped this inside the boundary. Luckily for them, he has

all the anger of that run-out Samuels has taken out on the poor ball. This is full on off, and he has missiled it back past McLaren for four. if Samuels bats 31 overs, West Indies stand a fair chance of winning this
length ball, on the pads, 89mph, 142ks, a gift on the pads, and Pollard has clipped it away for four
short of a length, seams back in, beats the inside edge, but they take the leg-bye
backs away, tries to smash it down the ground, the shortish ball doesn't carry to mid-off
backs away, and is beaten as he tries to smash another
pushed wide of cover for one
what a bouncer. Climbing and climbing from not too short, and at 91mph - 146ks. Pollard ducks under it
slower short ball, cut hard, but can't beat cover
bouncer, head high, somehow he plays a two-handed forehand over midwicket for two
out of the park. This is in Samuels' zone. He is hitting this ball as hard as it has been hit. This is on a length, on off, and he has hit it for a six out of the ground. What a clean swing
bouncer, follows him, Samuels still swings, gets a top edge, which clears the wicketkeeper with ease
he has nearly hit the most unbelievable of sixes to the longest boundary of the ground. This is short, chest high, on off, but he has still cut it over cover for four. Bounces just inside the rope
full and wide to beat him as Samuels swings from the crease
full. Flat. Pollard wants to send this to England, but has mis-hit down to long-on but along the ground
Samuels is some mood today, man. Down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, but he goes through with the shot and down the ground, and clears the short long-on boundary
that's a skimmer. Samuels is smoking them. Down the wicket, makes a bit of room, and sends it crashing over extra cover for four
down the wicket, and check that outfield, it must be singed after this. He has hit this all along the ground, on an outfield that has taken a lot of rain, and has still beaten long-on to his right
he is out of his crease again, but this time it goes off the outside half, and over point for one
Pollard hits it hard too, but not wide of the diving cover. Du Plessis keeps them down to one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point. Won't get any run there
outswinger. Outside off, from a length, beats the drive
bouncer, on the stumps, he quietly ducks under it
superb short ball. Rising towards the chest from just short of a length. Fended there for another dot
flicked away from middle and leg, gets a single to fine leg
short of a length, outside off, guided away to third man. Wonderful stuff from Steyn, but Samuels is still alive
Samuels back to opening up the front leg and hitting, but this is straight and provides him no room. Beaten
Samuels moves across and then backs away to hit, but is beaten outside off. Just a length ball that goes with the angle
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away for one
the third man is in the circle, and Pollard has got away with this. He swings hard at a slower ball, and gets a thick edge that clears short third man
Pollard swings blind again, and is beaten by the slower one outside off
that was a sing Tsotsobe was going to bowl short. Pollard knew it and was waiting. Pulled this hard over midwicket for four. That's nine off what was for the most part a good over
Samuels makes up his mind and pulls this over midwicket. Four four into the biggest boundary of the ground

timbaaaaaaaaaah. That's was fuller than before, quick and straight, bowled cross-seam, and then seams back in a touch. Only a touch. Samuels is standing with the front leg opened up, and he swings hard. Beaten by the mix of that pace, seam and skid off. Steyn has struck a huge blow. Tip your hat off to the best bowler in the world
bouncer, pulled away to deep square leg
that's five wides. Bouncer at 90mph. Beats everybody outside off. Even the keeper. Just the tennis-ball bounce
short of a length, 88mph, 141ks, Pollard swings hard, is beaten by the extra bounce
short of a length, quick, no room, defended to cover

walks down the wicket, gets inside the line, clips this off the pads, past the diving square leg. Tsotsobe fr0m short fine leg gives a clumsy chase, and pushes it for four. If the game stops now, we have a tie
length ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
slower ball, on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
slower shortish ball, on the pads, flicked past short fine leg for a couple
looks to drive at a length ball, gets a thick edge to deep cover for one
slower ball, full, a half-volley, drilled between the non-striker's end stumps and Dwayne Bravo for four. Well done Bravo for getting out of the way
short of a length, outside off, hit hard, but straight to extra cover. They get the single
short, into the ribs, mis-hits the pull, gets a single to short fine leg
short of a length, angling in, beats the inside edge, goes for a leg-bye

slower short ball, flicked to deep midwicket, he wants two, takes on Miller, and the under-pressure fielder throws wide. Had the throw been on target, it would have been very close. I can't believe we are going to the third umpire. De Villiers didn't even have the ball in hand, and the batsman is past the stumps. You can't waste time in such weather. Poor umpiring
goes for the yokrer, bowls it well down the leg side. Slipped out of the hand? At any rate, well done AB with that dive
good comeback. Short of a length, nips back in from outside off, and beats his pull on the inside
length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
mid-off is up and what a superb shot from Bravo. Length ball, outside off, he leans a little forward and sends it crashing over mid-off. They are fur ahead of par, but it is not raining now

Pollard has thrown it away. Throws his bat at a short-of-a-length ball, gets the top edge on it, the ball goes as high as it goes long, and Steyn comes under it at third man, and makes no mistake. Now the par score is 190. If we don't get any more cricket in, it's a tie
